DOCNAME: CASE OF IDALOVA AND IDALOV v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Procedural aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security;Violation of Article 13+2 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 2 - Right to life)
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively . At the material time they lived in the village of GPE , in LOC of GPE . They are currently residing in the village of GPE , in LOC of GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicants are the parents of Mr PERSON , born in DATE . They also have CARDINAL other sons : ORG and PERSON .
CARDINAL . At the material time ORG was a student at a secondary school . A certificate issued by the local authorities confirmed that ORG had not participated in any illegal armed groups .

CARDINAL . According to inhabitants of LOC , special military unit no . CARDINAL of ORG ( « CARDINAL-е стрелковое спецподразделение МО РФ DATE , hereinafter “ military unit no . CARDINAL ” ) was based near their village in DATE .
CARDINAL . On TIME the applicants and ORG were sleeping at their family home . TIME the first applicant went outside the house to perform an ablution .

CARDINAL . At TIME an armoured personnel carrier ( “ ORG ” ) , an infantry battle vehicle ( “ IBV ” ) and a Ural vehicle arrived at the Idalovs ' house ; a group of armed men wearing camouflage uniforms and masks descended from them . The first applicant inferred that the men belonged to the NORP military .

CARDINAL . The servicemen started breaking the entrance door and windows . The first applicant asked them why they were doing so . In reply the servicemen shouted at her and forced her to enter the house .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile CARDINAL or CARDINAL servicemen broke into the house without producing any documents or search warrants . The first applicant saw the faces of CARDINAL unmasked servicemen who had NORP features ; they spoke NORP without an accent . The servicemen hit the second applicant , tied his arms behind his back , forced him to the floor and pointed a machine gun at him .

CARDINAL . Marvan PERSON was studying when the servicemen entered his room . They tied his arms , put a sack on his head and took him to the street . It appears that they then put ORG in CARDINAL of the vehicles parked at the house and left . Some neighbours submitted that the vehicles drove away in the direction of the base of military unit no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . According to the decision of the district prosecutor 's office of DATE to grant the second applicant victim status in criminal case no . DATE , on DATE CARDINAL unidentified armed men wearing camouflage uniforms and masks travelling in an ORG , an ORG and a lorry with an anti - aircraft gun on it unlawfully entered the applicants ' house , kidnapped PERSON and took him away to an unknown destination .

CARDINAL . NORP Immediately after their son 's abduction the applicants requested information on his whereabouts from the head of special military unit no . CARDINAL , PERSON , who replied that the military servicemen under his command had not carried out any special operations in the morning of DATE and had not apprehended PERSON .

CARDINAL . The applicants continued searching for their son . They applied to various official bodies , such as the prosecutors ' offices at different levels , the departments of the interior , ORG , the NORP State PERSON and the Special Envoy of the NORP President in GPE , asking to help them to find PERSON . In their efforts the applicants were assisted by the PERSON . It appears that those complaints were futile .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant complained about her son 's disappearance to the military prosecutor 's office of ORG ( “ the ORG prosecutor 's office ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . CARDINAL ( “ the prosecutor 's office of unit no . CARDINAL ” ) sent a letter to the ORG prosecutor 's office and the first applicant concerning ORG disappearance . The copy of the letter submitted to the ORG is illegible .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE sent a letter to the ORG prosecutor 's office and the second applicant concerning ORG disappearance . The copy of the letter submitted to the ORG is illegible .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE forwarded the first applicant 's complaint about her son 's disappearance to the prosecutor 's office of LOC of GPE ( “ the district prosecutor 's office ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office invited the first applicant to send her queries concerning her son 's kidnapping to the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prosecutor 's office informed the first applicant that an inquiry into her son 's alleged kidnapping by unidentified military servicemen had been carried out . The inquiry established that on DATE the NORP military had not organised any special operations and had not apprehended ORG . No traces of military personnel implication in ORG kidnapping had been found .

CARDINAL . On DATE the North - Caucasus Operational Department of ORG of ORG of the Interior for ORG informed the first applicant that it had verified the facts relating to her son 's disappearance and had sent the collected materials to the prosecutor 's office of GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the SRJI wrote to the district prosecutor 's office , the prosecutor 's office of GPE and the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE , requesting them to inform it whether an investigation into ORG disappearance had been instituted and , if so , to provide details on the course of the investigation and to grant the first applicant the status of victim of a crime .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE replied to the SRJI that ORG had not been apprehended by servicemen of the department of the interior of LOC ( “ ROVD ” ) or kept in the temporary detention facility of the ROVD . They further noted that the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE had inquired into ORG kidnapping .
CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON repeated their requests concerning PERSON fate to the district prosecutor 's office and to the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE instituted an investigation into the disappearance of ORG under LAW of LAW ( aggravated kidnapping ) and ordered the district prosecutor 's office to assign a number to the case file . On DATE they informed the first applicant accordingly and invited her to send further queries to the district prosecutor 's office .
CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON wrote to the district prosecutor 's office and to the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE , repeating their requests of CARDINAL DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE informed the PERSON that it had instituted criminal proceedings in relation to ORG disappearance and that the investigation was under way .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE forwarded the ORG 's complaint about ORG kidnapping to the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . CARDINAL ( “ the prosecutor 's office of unit no . CARDINAL ” ) and requested that the SRJI submit a detailed description of the crime to that office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE forwarded the ORG 's complaint to the military prosecutor 's office of military unit no . DATE ( “ the prosecutor 's office of unit no . CARDINAL ” ) and requested that the ORG submit a detailed description of ORG kidnapping to that office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office granted the first applicant victim status in case no . DATE , instituted in relation to ORG kidnapping by unidentified armed persons . On DATE second applicant was informed of the decision to grant him the status of victim of a crime in case no . DATE , issued by the district prosecutor 's office on an unspecified date .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE forwarded the ORG 's complaint about ORG kidnapping to the prosecutor 's office of unit no . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON sent the prosecutor 's office of unit no . CARDINAL information on ORG kidnapping as requested by the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE forwarded the ORG 's letter to the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of unit no . CARDINAL informed the SRJI that there was no evidence of the implication of military personnel in the crime and that the investigation should therefore be carried out by a civilian prosecutor 's office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON requested the district prosecutor 's office , the prosecutor 's office of GPE and the prosecutor 's office of unit no . DATE to inform it of the state of the proceedings instituted in relation to ORG kidnapping .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE informed the PERSON that the first applicant had been granted victim status and that she would be updated on progress in the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE forwarded the applicants ' letter dated DATE to the ROVD and requested it to search for ORG and his kidnappers more actively and to inform the applicants of measures taken .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ROVD informed the applicants that the investigation into the kidnapping of GPE and PERSON in case no . DATE had been commenced on DATE and that investigative measures were being taken to solve the crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office informed the applicants that the investigation into the kidnapping of ORG had been resumed on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office received a complaint by the first applicant dated DATE and addressed to ORG GPE . According to the complaint , on an unspecified date during DATE of PERSON unidentified men wearing camouflage uniforms and masks had entered the Idalovs ' house in the village of GPE and kidnapped PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office ordered the ROVD to ensure the first applicant 's appearance before the investigators , to collect depositions by her relatives and to examine the scene of the incident .
CARDINAL . Later the ROVD reported that the first applicant 's whereabouts were unknown and that her neighbours had no information concerning the merits of her complaint .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office informed the prosecutor 's office of GPE that it was impossible to give a decision on the first applicant 's complaint owing to the failure to establish her whereabouts or to find any evidence of the facts complained of .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the temporary department of the interior of LOC ( “ NORP ” ) informed the district prosecutor 's office of the following . They had established that Vakhid and PERSON had been active members of illegal armed groups and that ORG had been an accomplice of insurgents . PERSON had been killed in DATE in a fight with federal servicemen . PERSON and PERSON had not been arrested by the NORP servicemen and had been hiding from the federal authorities .
CARDINAL . Several residents of Akhkinchu - Borzoy informed the investigation that CARDINAL of the first applicant 's sons had been involved in unlawful activities of illegal armed groups .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office decided on the basis of the inquiry 's results to refuse to institute criminal proceedings in the absence of any crime .

DATE . On DATE the prosecutor 's office of GPE quashed the decision of DATE and ordered the district prosecutor 's office to institute an investigation into ORG abduction under LAW of LAW ( aggravated kidnapping ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant was granted victim status and questioned . He submitted that ORG had been kidnapped on DATE by unknown persons in masks .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was granted victim status and questioned . She made a statement similar to that by her husband .

CARDINAL . The investigators requested information from law - enforcement agencies of GPE and were told in reply that ORG had not been arrested , prosecuted or held in any detention facilities and that no special operations had been carried out in FAC - Borzoy on DATE .
CARDINAL . The Idalovs ' relatives and neighbours were questioned in the course of the investigation and submitted that they had no information concerning the circumstances of ORG kidnapping .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office suspended the investigation in case no . CARDINAL concerning the kidnapping of ORG on DATE on account of the failure to identify those responsible and notified the applicants accordingly .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office resumed the investigation in case no . CARDINAL and notified the applicants accordingly .
CARDINAL . The investigation in case no . DATE was suspended on DATE and then resumed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office again suspended the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor 's office resumed the investigation in case no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted a copy of an undated document entitled “ Explanation ” , signed with the name of the first applicant and addressed to the prosecutor 's office of GPE . The document stated that in DATE a group of servicemen had found bags with firearms and ammunition in a cemetery in LOC near the Idalovs ' house . The first applicant had been detained for questioning for some time . Then she had found out that her son PERSON had been killed in unknown circumstances . In DATE her son PERSON had gone to the forest with insurgents . DATE he had returned home and started hiding from the authorities . Then he had tried to flee the country and to go to GPE . The first applicant had no information on his whereabouts . He might have been arrested by federal servicemen . At TIME on DATE the first applicant had seen an ORG , an ORG and a vehicle fitted with an anti - aircraft gun arriving at her house . CARDINAL armed men had entered the house ; all the men but one had been wearing masks , and the unmasked man was tall and had red hair . The armed men had taken away ORG . The first applicant had told of the kidnapping to officials of the district prosecutor 's office whom she had seen on the LOC .

CARDINAL . The investigation failed to identify the perpetrators . The involvement of federal troops in the kidnapping was not proven . The investigation was suspended several times owing to the failure to identify those responsible and was then resumed in order to verify certain items of information . It was pending under the supervision of ORG .

CARDINAL . Despite specific requests by ORG , the Government did not disclose most of the contents of the file in criminal case no . DATE , providing only copies of the first applicant 's “ explanation ” , several witnesses ' interviews , decisions to grant the applicants victim status and a few notifications to the applicants concerning the suspension and resumption of the investigation . Relying on the information obtained from ORG , the ORG stated that the investigation was in progress and that disclosure of the documents would be in violation of LAW , since the file contained information of a military nature and personal data concerning the witnesses or other participants in the criminal proceedings .
